intro: Struthiola lineariloba var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent linearleaf struthiola, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive pubescent appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
